meanings.definition: A main root growing vertically downward from which subsidiary roots arise.
meanings.sent1: The plant's taproot extended deep into the soil, providing stability and nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The taproot of the tree was crucial for its growth and survival.
meanings.sent3: The taproot decided to throw a party for all the little roots branching out from it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a taproot, firmly grounded and spreading strength to all aspects of her life.
meanings.sent5: The taproot's journey into the earth was a testament to its resilience and purpose.

meanings.sent1: In the story, the taproot of the plot was the unexpected twist at the end.
meanings.sent2: The taproot of the issue was identified during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The taproot of the cake was the delicious chocolate frosting on top.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like the taproot of his charm, drawing everyone in with its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The taproot of her painting was the vibrant splash of red in the center, capturing all attention.
